    • appointmentTableSetup

      public static void appointmentTableSetup(javafx.scene.control.TableView<Appointment> allAppointmentTable, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentIdColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentTitleColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentDescriptionColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentLocationColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,String> appointmentContactColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentTypeColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,String> appointmentStartColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,String> appointmentEndColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentCustomerIdColumn, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> appointmentUserId)
      Sets up the appointment table with the columns and data.
      Parameters:
      allAppointmentTable - The TableView to set up.
      appointmentIdColumn - The column for the appointment ID.
      appointmentTitleColumn - The column for the appointment title.
      appointmentDescriptionColumn - The column for the appointment description.
      appointmentLocationColumn - The column for the appointment location.
      appointmentContactColumn - The column for the appointment contact.
      appointmentTypeColumn - The column for the appointment type.
      appointmentStartColumn - The column for the appointment start time.
      appointmentEndColumn - The column for the appointment end time.
      appointmentCustomerIdColumn - The column for the customer ID associated with the appointment.
      appointmentUserId - The column for the user ID associated with the appointment.

    • displayScene

      public static void displayScene(String fxmlFile, javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Loads the specified scene. Crated a method to provide the fxml instead of this code block.
      Parameters:
      fxmlFile - The file of the scene to display.
      stage - The stage to display the scene in.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file is not found.

    • appointmentCheck

      public static void appointmentCheck()
      Checks for any appointments coming up within the next 15 minutes and displays an alert message. The alert message varies on whether there is an upcoming appointment or not. The scope did not contain it, I would have preferred no message unless an appointment was found and initialize it when the 'menu-menu' was called. Runs the SQL check to the database and saves the Appointment if found so that it may be displayed in the alert.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the scene, setting up the appointment filter and table, and the customer table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setupAppointmentFilter

      private void setupAppointmentFilter()
      Sets up the appointment filter with options and sets the default selection to "All".

    • changeAppointmentFilter

      private void changeAppointmentFilter()
      Changes the items displayed in the appointment table based on the selected filter option. LAMBDA expressions are used throughout the application when multiple selections are needed. It helps in my case to compare the old and new selection the run the code. In this case clearing the table and then getting the appointment time frames. IntelliJ also recommend the format for the updated cases. The code repository had a great example for alerts. alert.showAndWait().ifPresent((response -> I found this example in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41323945/javafx-combobox-add-listener-on-selected-item-value with the second answer with 8 upvotes.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Loads the 'main-menu.fxml' scene.

      Parameters:

    • noSelection

      private void noSelection()
      Displays an alert message when no item is selected from a table.

    • deleteAppointmentButton

      private void deleteAppointmentButton()
      Deletes the selected appointment from the database. Displays an alert message to confirm the deletion.

    • deleteCustomerButton

      private void deleteCustomerButton()
      Deletes the selected customer from the database. Also deletes any appointments associated with the customer. Displays an alert message to confirm the deletion.

    • addAppointmentButton

      private void addAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action when the 'Add Appointment' button is clicked. Loads the 'appointment-add.fxml' scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file 'appointment-add.fxml' is not found.

    • updateAppointmentButton

      private void updateAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action when the 'Update Appointment' button is clicked. Checks if an appointment is selected and loads the 'appointment-update.fxml' scene. If no appointment is selected, it calls the noSelection() method.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file 'appointment-update.fxml' is not found.

    • addCustomerButton

      private void addCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action when the 'Add Customer' button is clicked. Loads the 'customer-add.fxml' scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file 'customer-add.fxml' is not found.

    • updateCustomerButton

      private void updateCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action when the 'Update Customer' button is clicked. Checks if a customer is selected and loads the 'customer-update.fxml' scene. If no customer is selected, it calls the noSelection() method.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file 'customer-update.fxml' is not found.

    • reportsButton

      Parameters:
      event - The action event.
      Throws:
